intro: Anamenia coriacea, commonly known as the rough anamenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Anamenia coriacea is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
